titleStmt.title: Letter from George Colman to the Manager of Covent Garden, 10 October 1825.

You can have multiple notes here.

msDesc.head: Letter from George Colman to the Manager of Covent Garden 15 October, 1825.

support.p: PaperOne octavo sheet sheet folded twice. No address leaf or envelope.

supportDesc.condition: Letter complete on the front side of the sheet only.

sealDesc.p: Missing address leaf or envelope and seal.

editorialDecl.p: The letter writer's spelling and punctuation are retained, except where a word is split at the end of a line and the beginning of the next in the manuscript. Where the spelling and hyphenation of words deviates from the standard, in order to facilitate searching we are using the TEI elements “choice,” “sic,” and “reg” to encode both Mitford’s spelling and the regular international standard of Oxford English spelling, following the first listed spelling in the Oxford English Dictionary. The long s and ligatured forms are not encoded.

div.p: I am instructed to inform you thathave to inform you that The Lord Chamberlain declines granting a License to act thethisobjects against your intendedproposed representation of the Historical Tragedy entitled C the First, which you, lately, transmitted to me. ; the Subject of King Charles's Martyrdom erecting, in itself, one strong objection against it's representation. I have less regret in communicating this intelligence, as I think you might have anticipated it; & when there could have been little hope of permissionpermission, there can be little disappointment in a refusal.
div.closer:
I have the honour to be,
Sir,
your obedient servant, G. ColmanThe Manager,Theatre Royal,Covent Garden.
